22.author: Caridad Blanco ; translated from Spanish by Gisela Gil-Egui
22.appears_in: p. 178-189 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 2, no. 1 (Spring 2000).

Illustrated.

23.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
23.title: "Apuntes de un Dibujante y una Entrevista"
23.author: [No author]
23.series: Rafael Fornés Collado) p. 191-202 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios Sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 8
notes: Resumen: "Prácticamente desconocida en el exterior y lamentablement olvidado en su misma patria, en Cuba en los años 1957-1963 ha sido creada y publicada una de las historietas más lindas: 'Don Sabino' da Rafael Fornés Collado. El sentido profundo y los motivos inspiradores de la obra emergen vivament de los 'Apuntes de un Dibujante', y de la 'Entrevista a Sabino Fornés' publicados en el ya imposible de hallar no. de enero-agusto de 1976 de Signos, la estimulante revista dirigida por Samuel Feijóo. Por su gran interés, proponemos aquí de nuevo aquellos materiales, que para esta edición Fornés ha querido revisar, corregir y completar con nuevas observaciones. Atribuimos a él sólo su autoría, considerando que, como él mismo nos contaba, lo de la entrevista fue en realidad un expediente formal, y que fue él mismo quien escribió las preguntas y las respuestas."

Abstract: Practically unknown abroad and regrettably forgotten in its homeland, 'Don Sabino' by Rafael Fornés Collado was one of the most attractive comics to have been created and published in Cuba in the years 1957-1963. The depth and inspiration of the work are clearly to be seen in 'Notes of a Cartoonist' and 'Interview with Sabino Fornés,' published in the now impossible to find January-August 1876 issue of Signos, the stimulating Santa Clara magazine edited by Samuel Feijóo. Because of their great interest, we present these materials here again, which Fornés has wanted to revise, correct and complete with new observations for this edition. We attribute their authorship to him alone, since, as he has told us, the interview was only an expedient format and he wrote both the questions and the answers himself.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes samples of the Don Sabino strip, which are signed "Fornés".

24.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
24.title: "Casi Cinquenta Años con el Pincel en Mano : Charla con Eduardo Muñoz Bachs"
24.author: Darlo Mogno
24.appears_in: p. 193-200 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 3 (Sept. 2001).
notes: Resumen: "Para recordar al gran artista cubano Eduardo Muñoz Bachs, fallecido recientement, se publica una entrevista inédita de hace tres años, en que él recorre las etapas fundamentales de su carrera artistica y manifiesta sus preferencias en las áreas de la pintura, la literature y e cine."

Abstract: In memory of the great Cuban artist Eduardo Muñoz Bachs, who died recently, we present an unpublished interview from three years ago. Here he recounts the fundamental stages of his artistic career and indicates his preferences in the areas of painting, literature, and cinema.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations.

25.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
25.title: El Cómic Hispánico
25.author: Ana Merino.
notes: (Signo e Imagen ; 74)
Substantial chapters on the comics of Spain, Cuba, Mexico, and Argentina.
Includes bibliographical references (p. 273-281).

26.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
26.title: "Cuadros"
26.author: Caridad Blanco de la Cruz
26.appears_in: p. 31-45 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 1 (Abril 2001).
notes: Resumen: "Cuadros es una propuesta de recorrido por la historia de la historieta cubana; un modo de ensartar un grupo considerable de los fragmentos imprescindibles para reconstruirla desde una actualidad en la que muchas veces se pierden de vista los elementos puntuales que han sostenido y desarrollado a la narrativa dibujada como una de las expresiones de las artes visuales en Cuba."

Abstract: Cuadros (squares) is a recurring proposition throughout the history of Cuban comics. This is an attempt to link a group of essential fragments, a way to rebuild history retrospectively, a history which has lost sight, in many cases, of elements that have supported and developed the drawn narrative as one of the expressions of the visual arts in Cuba.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.

27.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
27.title: "Dispositivo Didáctico para la Formación de una Cultura Integral en la Historieta Cubana"
27.author: Roberto Hernández
27.appears_in: p. 13-22 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 2, no. 5 (Mar. 2002).
notes: Includes illustrations.
Presented at the 7th Encuentro Internacional de Historietistas, Havana, Feb. 2002.
Running title: "Para la Formación de una Cultura Integral en la Historieta Cubana."

Resumen: "La utilización de la historieta como un instrumento útil para la divulgación de enseñanzas sociales, culturales, científicas o técnicas, es analizada en la ponencia, partiendo desde los origenes del cambio social revolucionario en Cuba, y sus distintas aplicaciones, no exentas de dificultades, hasta el momento actual."

Abstract: "The comics as a useful tool to spread social, cultural, scientific or technical teachings are analyzed, beginning from the origins of the revolutionary social changes in Cuba. The various uses, including the difficulties, are described up to the present moment."
Abstracts as published with the article, with some editing of the English.

30.title: "Parallel Lives : Comics and Animated Cartoons in Cuba from Beginning to Present"
30.author: Dario Mogno
30.appears_in: p. 83-105 in International Journal of Comic Art, v. 3, no. 2 (Fall 2001).
notes: (Latin American Comic Art : A Symposium)
Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.

31.heading: Cuban Comic Books, Strips, Etc.--Articles About.
31.title: "Salomón, un Mutante Perturbador"
31.author: Caridad Blanco de la Cruz
31.appears_in: p. 108-118 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 2 (Junio 2001).
notes: Resumen: "'Salomón' está considerado por los creadores gráficos del pais como el personaje que innovó el lenguaje humoristico de la historieta cubana por toda su carga filosófica, existencial y humanista. Santiago Armada (Chago: 1937-1995), su creador, es también considerado un artista que desdeñó las clasificaciones y motivaciones epidérmicas en el género. La relación obra-autor es analizada en este breve ensayo."

Abstract: 'Salomón' is considered by graphics creators as the character that initiated the language of humorous Cuban comics, with all its philosophical, existential and humanistic content. Santiago Armada (Chago: 1937-1995), his creator, is also considered to be an artist who disdained the classifications and shallow expectations of the genre. The relationship between the work and its author is analysed in this brief essay.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations and bibliographical references.

117.heading: Cubs.
117.title: The Lion King.
117.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.
Library has book only intended to accompany a set of 2 DVDs.
